resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/106312</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>106312</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770204303</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">What makes you scream?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Was bildet Sie Scream?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Que vous fait le cri perçant ?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Que lhe faz o grito?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Che cosa vi rende il grido?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτό που σας κάνει την κραυγή;</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">¿Qué le hace grito?</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Students will study Edvard Munch's painting "The Scream". They will then produce their own scream using directional lines as Munch did. Line was used by Munch in a variety of directions-horizontal, vertical and diagonal. This will help the eye travel to the central theme of the composition: the person's fright or what they fear.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Kursteilnehmer studieren Edvard Munchs Anstrich "der 
Scream". Sie produzieren dann ihren eigenen Scream mit 
Richtungszeilen wie Munch. Zeile wurde vorbei Munch in einer 
Vielzahl von Richtung-horizontalem, von Vertikale und von Diagonale 
benutzt. Dieses hilft dem Auge, zum zentralen Thema des Aufbaus 
zu reisen: der Schrecken der Person oder, was sie fürchten.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les étudiants étudieront Edvard ont mâché la peinture 
"le cri perçant". Ils produiront alors leur propre cri perçant
en utilisant les lignes directionnelles comme mâchent . La 
ligne a été utilisée près mâchent dans une variété de 
direction-horizontal, de verticale et de diagonale. Ceci aidera 
l'oeil pour voyager au thème central de composition : l'effroi 
de la personne ou ce qu'ils craignent.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Os estudantes estudarão Edvard munch a pintura "o grito".
Produzirão então seu próprio grito usando linhas direcionais 
como munch . A linha foi usada perto munch em uma variedade de 
sentido-horizontal, do vertical e da diagonal. Isto ajudará ao 
olho viajar ao tema central da composição: o fright da pessoa 
ou o que temem.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Gli allievi studeranno Edvard munch la pittura "il grido".
Allora produrranno il loro proprio grido usando le righe 
direzionali come munch. La riga è stata usata vicino munch in 
una varietà di senso-orizzontale, di verticale e di diagonale. 
Ciò aiuterà l'occhio per viaggiare al tema centrale della 
composizione: il fright della persona o che cosa temono.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οι σπουδαστές θα μελετήσουν Edvard Munch 
χρωματίζοντας "την κραυγή". Θα παραγάγουν έπειτα την κραυγή
τους χρησιμοποιώντας τις κατευθυντικές γραμμές όπως Munch. 
Η γραμμή χρησιμοποιήθηκε από Munch σε ποικίλος 
κατεύθυνση-οριζόντιος, κάθετος και διαγώνιος. Αυτό θα 
βοηθήσει το ταξίδι ματιών στο κεντρικό θέμα της σύνθεσης: 
ο τρόμος του προσώπου ή τι φοβούνται.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Los estudiantes estudiarán Edvard mascaron la pintura "el
grito". Entonces producirán su propio grito usando líneas 
direccionales como mascan. La línea fue utilizada cerca masca 
en una variedad de direccio'n-horizontal, de vertical y de diagonal. 
Esto ayudará al ojo para viajar al tema central de la 
composición: el fright de la persona o qué temen.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
N:CATHY CRUMPLER
FN:CATHY CRUMPLER
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770204303</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>LRE.roleMetaValues</source>
              <value>provider</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
VERSION:3.0
N:OERCommons
FN:OERCommons
ORG:OERCommons
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="x-t-cc-url">http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/</string>
            <string language="en">Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 2.5</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>106312</entry>
    </identifier>

      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/what-makes-you-scream</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
